channel.title: Webs.com webclient help
channel.description: So my webclient atm looks like this http://gyazo.com/d8aa206cb2d651e3e56a5712013e5a1f i have the code for the full html but i cant put it on my webs page because there is a header on the top and stuff there this is what it should look like: http://gyazo.com/ad1c728b0ec4c9cc3d8f7b49378b89a6 so on webs.com websites where do i put the html [u]so it covers the full webpage[/u]

item.title: Webs.com webclient help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

AssassinsCRB:

im sorry but what is css and smf :o also can you recommend any cool website templates fit for rsps?

CSS: Cascading Style Sheets. It’s essentially customizes the HTML you add.
SMF: Simple Machine Forums. I.E: The forum software Moparscape uses.

xxInfamousxx:

Look for RCS 1.4, very good, and easy to work. And use 000webhost.com.

RCS 1.4 could get him banned on 000webhost, assuming they check it.

But yes, use 000webhost.

Read full topic

item.title: Webs.com webclient help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

AssassinsCRB:

do you know and good free sites? also ik invision powerboard isnt free but is it easy to use? it looks cool

No, IPB is horrid. I have a nulled copy of it. and I don’t even like it. Making each topic, sub topic, and board just sucks.
Stick with SMF or one of the alternates to it.
Edit:

[quote=“AssassinsCRB, post:5, topic:480130”]luna, i cant get rid of this header: http://gyazo.com/753c24cee0eadad1477ee65ee27e3e98

also clay how much money are we looking at :o? also rsgp or irl $ i will pm u my skype[/quote]
You can get rid of the header, if you use CSS to hide it. That’s also assuming it allows you to use CSS.

Read full topic

item.title: Webs.com webclient help
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Search for website templates on Google and download SMF for your forums. Use a hosting site that has cPanel because it’s very easy to use. X10Hosting is decent to use.

Read full topic
